headline: Does S&P Global’s (SPGI) Steady Earnings Focus Mask a Deeper Shift in Its Growth Playbook?
summary: S&P Global recently presented at the AFSA Vehicle Finance Conference & Expo 2026 in Las Vegas, with Managing Director Amy Martin highlighting the firm’s role in auto finance analytics, as the market also awaits its upcoming earnings report expected to show year-on-year revenue growth. Analysts’ largely unchanged estimates and focus on S&P Global’s profitability and use of share buybacks underscore how closely investors monitor its earnings updates. We’ll look at how anticipation around S&P...

headline: Moody’s and FactSet stocks slide on S&P Global’s weak 2026 outlook
summary: Investing.com -- Moody’s Corporation (NYSE:MCO) stock fell 5%, FactSet Research (NYSE:FDS) dropped 2%, and MSCI Inc (NYSE:MSCI) declined 2.7% Tuesday as investors reacted to disappointing guidance from industry peer S&P Global.

headline: S&P Global Stock Plunges. Mixed Earnings Highlight Software Sector Weakness.
summary: S&P Global Inc  shares fell sharply Tuesday as the financial information group posted a mixed set of fourth-quarter earnings after last week’s software sector slump added to concerns over profitability and growth.  Group revenue rose 9% to $3.92 billion, matching analysts’ estimates.  S&P Global shares slid 17% to $370 in premarket trading.

headline: S&P Global: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The New York-based company said it had profit of $3.75 per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, came to $4.30 per share. The results missed Wall Street expectations.

content.title: S&P Global: Q4 Earnings Snapshot

headline: S&P Global shares plunge as weak 2026 guidance fuels fears
summary: Investing.com -- S&P Global shares have declined more than 18% in pre-market trading on Tuesday after the company posted a narrow earnings miss and issued weaker-than-expected 2026 guidance, prompting analysts to flag mounting concerns over the pace of growth.

headline: Here's Why S&P Global (SPGI) is Poised for a Turnaround After Losing 18.4% in 4 Weeks
summary: S&P Global (SPGI) has become technically an oversold stock now, which implies exhaustion of the heavy selling pressure on it. This, combined with strong agreement among Wall Street analysts in revising earnings estimates higher, indicates a potential trend reversal for the stock in the near term.

headline: S&P Global Stock Sinks. Why Earnings Couldn’t Resolve AI Concerns.
summary: S&P Global Inc  shares fell sharply Tuesday as the financial information group posted a mixed set of fourth-quarter earnings, compounding losses suffered after last week’s AI-driven information-services slump.  S&P Global stock was down 6.9% at $413.60, while the  was up 0.3%, and the  rose 0.5%.  Looking into the current calendar year, S&P Global said revenue growth will likely slow to between 6.6% and 8.6%.

Looking into the current calendar year, S&P Global said revenue growth will likely slow to between 6.6% and 8.6%.

headline: These Stocks Are Today’s Movers: Spotify, S&P Global, CVS, Coca-Cola, TSMC, Datadog, Kyndryl, Credo, and More
summary: Spotify Technology  jumped 14% after the audio-streaming giant posted better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings and said its monthly active users rose 11% from a year earlier to 751 million, higher than the company’s prior guidance.  The healthcare company reported fourth-quarter earnings that beat Wall Street expectations and reiterated its 2026 guidance for adjusted earnings of between $7 and $7.20 a share.  Coca-Cola  fell 2% after fourth-quarter revenue growth in the beverage giant’s fourth quarter was slower than expected.

content.title: These Stocks Are Today’s Movers: Spotify, S&P Global, CVS, Coca-Cola, TSMC, Datadog, Kyndryl, Credo, and More
content.summary: Spotify Technology  jumped 14% after the audio-streaming giant posted better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings and said its monthly active users rose 11% from a year earlier to 751 million, higher than the company’s prior guidance.  The healthcare company reported fourth-quarter earnings that beat Wall Street expectations and reiterated its 2026 guidance for adjusted earnings of between $7 and $7.20 a share.  Coca-Cola  fell 2% after fourth-quarter revenue growth in the beverage giant’s fourth quarter was slower than expected.

headline: S&P Global (NYSE:SPGI) Posts Q4 CY2025 Sales In Line With Estimates
summary: Financial intelligence company S&P Global (NYSE:SPGI) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 9% year on year to $3.92 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $4.30 per share was 0.8% below analysts’ consensus estimates.
